basicInfo.notes: Founded 2015 as ZEIT by Guillermo Rauch (Socket.IO creator). Rebranded to Vercel in 2020. Creators and maintainers of Next.js framework. Raised $863M total, $9.3B valuation after Sept 2025 Series F. Also created v0 AI and AI SDK. Headquarters in San Francisco. Remote-first company. The canonical host for Next.js applications.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: No refunds; Free tier available for testing

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Hobby: 100GB included, Pro: 1TB included then pay-as-you-go
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Crypto mining; excessive resource usage; ToS violations
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Free tier generous but limited; Hobby tier non-commercial only; Pro $20/mo + usage; Enterprise custom; Serverless function limits; Bandwidth overages can add up; Edge requests 1M hobby/10M pro; Data transfer costs extra

contentRestrictions.contentNotes: Jamstack/frontend focus; Hobby tier personal/non-commercial only

editorial.knownIssues: Trustpilot 1.7 reflects billing frustrations and support issues; Hobby tier non-commercial restrictions; Usage-based billing can be unpredictable; No live chat support; Debugging deployments can be tricky; Free tier limits restrictive for larger projects; Vendor lock-in concerns with Next.js optimizations
editorial.bestFor: Next.js applications; React/frontend developers; Jamstack sites; Serverless applications; Preview deployments workflow; Teams wanting zero-config deployments; Modern web applications
editorial.avoidIf: Need WordPress hosting; Want predictable billing; Need live chat support; Running non-JavaScript backends; Budget-conscious with variable traffic; Need traditional hosting features
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Creators of Next.js - canonical host; G2 4.6 excellent but Trustpilot 1.7 poor; $9.3B valuation; Zero-config deployments; Automatic preview URLs; Competes with Netlify, Cloudflare Pages, AWS Amplify; v0 AI for code generation

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Creators of Next.js with zero-config deployments and automatic preview URLs for every git push
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Frontend developer or team building Next.js/React applications wanting zero-config deployments with preview environments

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Vercel is excellent for Next.js and React apps with G2 4.6 rating. Creators of Next.js framework. Trustpilot 1.7 reflects billing/support frustrations. Best for frontend developers.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Vercel is an independent VC-backed company founded in 2015 by Guillermo Rauch. Valued at $9.3B after September 2025 Series F funding. Creators of Next.js.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Hobby tier free (non-commercial). Pro $20/month + usage. Enterprise custom pricing. Usage-based billing for bandwidth, functions, and edge requests.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Easy for developers familiar with Git and modern frameworks. Zero-config deployment. Not ideal for non-technical users or WordPress.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, Vercel does not include email hosting. Use third-party email services.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: No, Vercel is designed for Jamstack, Next.js, and modern frontend frameworks. Not suitable for WordPress.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Vercel guarantees 99.99% uptime for Enterprise plans with SLA credits.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, no long-term contracts. Free tier available. Pro plan billed monthly.
